hypothesis_content.title: Bull Regime Fatigue Detection via Momentum-Volume Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During BULL regimes, when BTC makes a 60-day high but on declining volume (below 20D average) while daily RSI(14) shows bearish divergence (price higher high, RSI lower high) and social sentiment extreme (>90th percentile), the subsequent 8% correction will trigger transition to NEUTRAL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bull regimes typically end with exhaustion moves - price highs unsupported by volume, weakening momentum (RSI divergence), and euphoric sentiment. These conditions indicate diminishing buyer participation and increased vulnerability to profit-taking, often leading to corrective phases and regime normalization.
entry_conditions: BTC makes 60D high on volume < 20D average volume
Daily RSI(14) shows bearish divergence (price higher high, RSI lower high)
Crypto social sentiment index > 90th percentile (7D average)
BTC declines 8% from high on increasing volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence > 60%) OR 12% decline from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC makes new 60D high with volume confirmation
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14 days without regime transition or significant correction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Correction remains shallow (<5%) and bull regime resumes with volume confirmation, indicating healthy consolidation rather than regime transition.
